instruction:
1. Study the ARA and RRA of S&P 500 in different time periods (1993-1998 and 1999-2005) to determine the risk attitude of US investors across the years.
2. Check whether the evidence of DRRA and CRRA in earlier studies is supported by our model.
output: Based on the findings, it appears that the risk attitude of US investors has changed over time. During the period of 1993-1998, investors displayed a declining risk attitude (DRRA), which supports the evidence found in earlier studies. However, during the period of 1999-2005, the risk attitude was less clear, with the graph being indecisive between constant relative risk aversion (CRRA) and increasing relative risk aversion (IRRA).
